titleStmt.title: The humble petition of the Lords & Commons assembled in Parliament unto His Majesty (with reasons moving them to advise His Majesty) to decline his intended journey into Ireland sent to Yorke by the Earle of Stamford, Sir Iohn Culpepper, knight, Chancellour of the Exchequer, and Anthony Hungerford, esquire, who presented the same to His Majesty at York on Monday last, being the 18 day of April, 1642.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by A.N. for John Franck,

notesStmt.note: "And ordered to be printed and published by the Commons of Parliament. Die Veneris 22 of April. H. Elsyng, Cler. Parl. D. Com."
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.
